previous: As of January 2014 a total of 86 BAE 146 aircraft (all variants) remain in airline service.[63] Major operators include:

Firefighting air tanker versions of both the BAe 146 and the Avro RJ85 have been manufactured via the conversion of aircraft previously operated by airlines.[55] Several organisations carry out such conversions, including U.S.-based Minden Air Corporation, Neptune Aviation Services, and Aero Flite.[56][57][58][59] In January 2012, Conair Group announced its arrangements to market and promote the Avro RJ85 as a major air tanker platform.[60] In October 2012, Air Spray Aviation of Alberta, Canada purchased its first BAe 146 for conversion into an air tanker.[55] Air Spray purchased a second airframe for conversion in October 2013.[61]
